Package org.securecryptoconfig

Class PlaintextContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainer
  • public class PlaintextContainer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for a container representing the plaintext processed in cryptographic use cases. A PlaintextContainer contains the plaintext as byte[] representation. The class provides various cryptography operations that can be performed on the plaintext (e.g. encryption, signing). A new PlaintextContainer can be created like this: 
     
 String plaintext = "Plaintext";
 PlaintextContainer container = new PlaintextContainer(plaintext.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8));

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​(java.nio.charset.Charset c)

        E.g 
         
  PlaintextContainer container = new PlaintextContainer(byte[]);
  String s = container.toString(StandardCharsets.UTF_8);

      • toString

        @Deprecated
public java.lang.String toString()
        Deprecated.
        Do not use the Java default toString() Method. Use toString(Charset) instead.
        Returns String representation of PlaintextContainer. As charset "UTF-8" is used. To choose another charset call PlaintextContainerInterface.toString(Charset)
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String

      • validateHash

        public boolean validateHash​(org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCHash hash)
                     throws SCCException
        Validate a given SCCHash against a PlaintextContainer value. The PlaintextContainer value will be hashed again and compared if resulting hash is identical to the given one.
        Parameters:
        hash - : SCCHash
        Returns:
        boolean
        Throws:
        SCCException

      • validatePasswordHash

        public boolean validatePasswordHash​(org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCPasswordHash passwordHash)
                             throws SCCException
        Validate a given SCCPasswordHash against a PlaintextContainer value representing the password. The PlaintextContainer value will be hashed again and compared if resulting hash is identical to the given one.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        boolean
        Throws:
        SCCException

      • encryptSymmetric

        public SCCCiphertext encryptSymmetric​(org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCKey key)
                               throws SCCException
        Symmetric encryption with a certain SCCKey for a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
        The encryption can be done as follows: 
         
  PlaintextContainer c = new PlaintextContainer(plaintextBytes);
  SCCCiphertext ciphertext = c.encryptSymmetric(sccKey);

        A new SCCKey for performing can be created with SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase) as follows: 
         
 	SCCKey key = SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase.SymmetricEncryption);
        Alternatively it is also possible to create a key derived from a password with SCCKey.createSymmetricKeyWithPassword(byte[]): 
         
 	SCCKey key = SCCKey.createSymmetricKeyWithPassword(password);
        Also it is possible to create a SCCKey from already existing SCCKey byte[] with SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(byte[]):: 
         
 SCCKey key = SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(existingSCCKey)
        Parameters:
        key - : SCCKey
        Returns:
        SCCCiphertext
        Throws:
        SCCException

      • encryptAsymmetric

        public SCCCiphertext encryptAsymmetric​(org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCKey key)
                                throws SCCException
        Asymmetric encryption with a certain SCCKey for a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
        The encryption can be done as follows: 
         
 	PlaintextContainer c = new PlaintextContainer(plaintextBytes);
  SCCCiphertext c = c.encryptAsymmetric(sccKey);

        A new SCCKey for performing can be created with SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase) as follows: 
         
 	SCCKey key = SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase.AsymmetricEncryption);
        Also it is possible to create a SCCKey from already existing SCCKey byte[] with SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(byte[]):: 
         
 SCCKey key = SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(existingSCCKey)
        Parameters:
        key - : SCCKey
        Returns:
        SCCCiphertext
        Throws:
        SCCException

      • sign

        public SCCSignature sign​(org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCKey key)
                  throws SCCException
        Signing with a certain SCCKey for a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
        The signing can be done as follows: 
         
 	PlaintextContainer c = new PlaintextContainer(plaintextBytes);
  SCCSignature sig = c.sign(sccKey);

        A new SCCKey for performing can be created with SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase) as follows: 
         
 	SCCKey key = SCCKey.createKey(KeyUseCase.Signing);
        Also it is possible to create a SCCKey from already existing SCCKey byte[] with SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(byte[]):: 
         
 SCCKey key = SCCKey.createFromExistingKey(existingSCCKey)
        Parameters:
        key - : SCCKey
        Returns:
        SCCSignature
        Throws:
        SCCException

      • hash

        public SCCHash hash()
             throws SCCException
        Hashing of a plaintext (PlaintextContainer).
        The hashing can be done as follows: 
         
 	PlaintextContainer c = new PlaintextContainer(plaintextBytes);
  SCCHash hash = c.hash();
        Returns:
        SCCHash
        Throws:
        SCCException

      • passwordHash

        public SCCPasswordHash passwordHash()
                             throws SCCException
        Assume the plaintext (PlaintextContainer) represents a password and perform password hashing.
        The password hashing can be done as follows: 
         
 	PlaintextContainer c = new PlaintextContainer(passwordBytes);
  SCCPasswordHash hash = scc.passwordHash();
        Returns:
        SCCPasswordHash
        Throws:
        SCCException
